page.title: 11HORLEY CARNIVAL
page.content: { Horley Carnival,}15th June 1985. Horley Round Table organised the event and hoped to raise Â£3000 to equip the new Day Centre in Albert Road. The parade assembled at Horley Comprehensive School, Balcombe Road. Floats were prepared by local groups such as Guides, Brownies, Scouts and Cubs, Youth Club, Football Club, Meath Green, Court Lodge and Horley First Schools, East Surrey Play Group and Ladies Barbershop Group. Also in the parade were BMX riders, 3 bands, majorettes and a children's circus.The theme was "community spirit". The procession arrived at the Recreation Ground, Brighton Road at 2.00pm where it joined the fair. Stalls included raffles, tombolas, win-a-car, coconut shy. Activities taking place were tug'o'war, Punch and Judy and 5 a side football. Over Â£4000 was raised.
